discussion_comments.comment_body: Include this as a nested `dom` module underneath `react-router`

Running `pnpm run docs:jsdoc` now gives you the following error:

```sh
Warning: Skipping signature section for `export const` component: createRoutesFromElements
file:///Users/michaeldeboey/Developer/Remix/react-router/scripts/docs.ts:610
          throw new Error(
                ^

Error: Unable to find cross-referenced documentation for param type: RouterProviderProps.flushSync
    at file:///Users/michaeldeboey/Developer/Remix/react-router/scripts/docs.ts:610:17
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at simplifyComment (file:///Users/michaeldeboey/Developer/Remix/react-router/scripts/docs.ts:589:16)
    at async Promise.all (index 1)
    at async generateMarkdownDocs (file:///Users/michaeldeboey/Developer/Remix/react-router/scripts/docs.ts:341:28)
    at async run (file:///Users/michaeldeboey/Developer/Remix/react-router/scripts/docs.ts:168:5)
```

This is caused due to the fact that JSDoc now has two `RouterProvider` components and two `RouterProviderProps` types as they're both exported by  `index` and `dom`, so JSDoc just takes the last one.
In the case of the error, that's the one from `dom`, which explicitly omits `flushSync` in this case

```ts
export type RouterProviderProps = Omit<BaseRouterProviderProps, "flushSync">;
```
Thanks!  Just got the `docs.ts` script updated to handle the new module
Necessary to get the note out of `useRevalidator`'s example code block
We can lift the note above the example so it shows in the summary and then we shouldn't need to try to detect this - I updated that file in f96433f37

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -85,6 +85,7 @@ export type {
   AwaitProps,
   IndexRouteProps,
   LayoutRouteProps,
+  MemoryRouterOpts,
discussion_comments.comment_body: Export this and `DOMRouterOpts` so they get picked up by typedoc
